meanings.definition: In the style of Italian architecture or art.
meanings.sent1: The house had an italianate design with colorful tiles and arched windows.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery featured many italianate paintings with vibrant colors and intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The italianate villa looked so elegant that it made the neighboring houses seem plain in comparison.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was an italianate masterpiece, combining sophistication with a touch of flair.
meanings.sent5: The italianate architecture of the cathedral left visitors in awe of its beauty and grandeur.

meanings.definition: To make or become Italian in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to italianate her cooking by using traditional herbs and spices.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the restaurant's menu began to italianate, offering more pasta dishes and gelato.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to italianate his wardrobe by wearing designer labels backfired when he realized they were knock-offs.
meanings.sent4: The garden was italianated with the addition of statues and a fountain, giving it a European charm.
meanings.sent5: The town square was italianated with a lively market, creating a bustling and vibrant atmosphere.
